speaker: Sherry
text: Morning, sunshine!

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning, Sherry.

speaker: Sherry
text: Coffee's on, want a cuppa?

speaker: Frasier
text: No thank you, caffeine only weakens the immune system. I'm fighting off a flu.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  Let me get you some breakfast.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no that's really not necessary.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, no, no, you'll feel much better once you've had my scrambled egg tacos and Spam patties.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, in keeping with the trusty adage, "starve a cold, disgust a fever."

speaker: Daphne
text: Tea and dry toast?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, bless you.  _In the kitchen, Sherry removes fresh biscuits from the oven. Daphne enters the kitchen and begins washing a dish._

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh honey, I was using that!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, sorry.

speaker: Sherry
text: No problem.  Listen, why don't you just relax?  I'll clean up later.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, not to criticise, but I usually serve Mr. Crane whole grain cereal for breakfast.  I try to avoid giving him fried foods.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, Marty loves fried foods.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes well, just because he likes something doesn't mean it's good for him.

speaker: Sherry
text: True, but just because something's good for him doesn't mean that he has to be stuck with it day after day.

speaker: Martin
text: It looks like it's going to be another scorcher.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm.

speaker: Martin
text: Radio said high nineties.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_not interested_] Yes, hot.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well, I guess they'll be some more brown-outs.  I hate to think what it'll do to the crops.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad please, I'm trying to read.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure, sorry. [_reading:_] Oh, another double homicide last night.  You know, with this heat wave going I'm not surprised. I wonder what started that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps someone wouldn't stop talking about the weather.

speaker: Martin
text: What?  Yeah, you might be right, it's a real scorcher out there.

speaker: Sherry
text: Morning, handsome!  Did I say that before?

speaker: Martin
text: Before, _and_ after!

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, would you two spare me the single entendre this morning?  I'm trying to avoid getting sick.

speaker: Sherry
text: Well there's nothing like one of momma's big biscuits if you're fighting something off. [_hands one to him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm sure with good aim it could bring down an elk!

speaker: Sherry
text: [_to Daphne:_] What about you, sweetie?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, just half of one for me.

speaker: Sherry
text: [_places one on her plate:_] Oh come on, wouldn't hurt you to put on a few pounds.  Men like to see a little oomph in your walk-away.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, you ought to see them smile when Sherry leaves the room!

speaker: Daphne
text: I can imagine. [_laughs with Frasier_]

speaker: Sherry
text: [_holds Daphne's face:_] Oh, now, you're so pretty.  I don't understand why men aren't just buzzing around you.  Frasier, you're not seeing anybody.  Here you are under the same roof, both cute as corn!  Why don't you two...

speaker: Frasier
text: Just stop right there.  I'm trying to have a peaceful morning and I do not want to be put on the spot, I do not want to eat some bizarre breakfast concoction, [_to Martin:_] and I do not want to discuss the weather.  I just want to try and conserve energy, sit here, and enjoy my paper.

speaker: Martin
text: Sure, Fras.  _Martin, without speaking, mimes asking for something.  Sherry, without speaking, gives him a taco shell filled with scrambled eggs. They carry on doing this along with Daphne, completely irritating Frasier.  He pretends to ignore it and turns over his newspaper.  Eventually, the three take a big loud bite from their tacos which makes Frasier pick up his paper and leave.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - KACL. In Frasier's booth, Roz and Bulldog are fighting like a couple of ten-year-olds.  Several employees are watching them from the hallway and laughing.  Roz forces him face-down over the console and pounds him with her fist._

speaker: Roz
text: I'm gonna break every bone in your bent little body!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, if you weren't a girl and I didn't kinda like this, I'd be pounding ya!  [_N.B. How like Ugolino and the Archbishop in Dante's "Inferno."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Bup-bup-bup!  Not another word!

speaker: Roz
text: But he...!

speaker: Frasier
text: Bup!  I don't care who did what to whom or in what disgusting manner.  As we speak, hordes of viral Visigoths are hurling themselves over the battlements of my immune system, laying waste to my... Oh, dear God, you see how weak I am?  I can't even finish a simple Visigoth metaphor.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well, if you get sick don't go sneezing on everything. The last time the Happy Chef got a cold I was peeling lettuce off the mike for a week.

speaker: Roz
text: You will not believe what he...

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey!  Roz, I meant what I said!  I simply cannot deal with other people's problems today.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, good news for Mark on line three, whose wife is keeping a pumpkin in a bassinet!  Hey, I know what'll make you feel better.  My friend Lisa's having a singles party tonight. I'm supposed to bring someone who I'm not interested in but who's a really good catch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh... Roz, please, I need my rest.  You know, even if I didn't, I do not want to be poked and prodded by a bunch of desperate, alcohol-lubricated husband-hunters.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, come on, it'll be fun! [_suggestively_] Cheryl from Sales was asking if you'd be there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Cheryl - isn't she the one who, at the last company wedding, hip-checked you into the ice sculpture in her headlong rush to catch the bouquet?

speaker: Roz
text: That is not what happened!  She thought the bartender said "last call."

speaker: Bulldog
text: Look Roz, I'm not going to fight you anymore.  But I want you to know you said a lot of things that really hurt my feelings. Fun is fun, but I'm not made of stone.  So I want you to know as of this moment, we work together but we are no longer friends!

speaker: Roz
text: Do you want to go to a party tonight?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I'm there! **CAT FIGHT ON A HOT TIN ROOF** _Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. Martin and Sherry are playing cards in the living room, when Daphne Enters with the exercise mat._

speaker: Daphne
text: Ready to do your exercises?

speaker: Martin
text: No, in a minute.

speaker: Sherry
text: Just a couple more hands.

speaker: Daphne
text: You said that half an hour ago!

speaker: Sherry
text: [_to Martin:_] Guess I must be a bad influence.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, next thing you know you're going to have me smoking behind the gym! [_they laugh_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry, but it's for your own good.  I want you down on your back in two minutes and no arguments.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Sherry:_] Sounds a lot better when you say it! [_they laugh_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello?  Speaking.  Oh, she did, did she?  Well, Sherry was mistaken, I don't go out with people I've never met.  Thank you anyway. [_puts phone down_] I can't believe it!  You gave my number to a total stranger?!

speaker: Sherry
text: I thought it would be a nice surprise, you're not seeing anybody.  Kenny is a great guy!

speaker: Daphne
text: He said his name was Jack.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, I forgot about Jack.

speaker: Daphne
text: There's more than one?!

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, I hope you're a lot nicer to Kenny when he calls.  He has a boat!

speaker: Daphne
text: Why don't you just squeeze me into a pair of hot-pants and drop me off down by the docks? _Sherry rises, insulted.  At the same moment, Frasier is getting in the elevator to go to his (hopefully) peaceful home.  No luck, I'm afraid.  A man gets into the elevator clearing his throat.  This makes Frasier nervous.  Suddenly, as the doors close, the man begins coughing violently, scaring Frasier.  However, when Frasier gets up to his floor, violence takes on a new meaning.  In the apartment, things are going bad._

speaker: Sherry
text: Maybe you wouldn't be so touchy if you didn't wake up on the wrong side of _no one_ every morning.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's your answer to everything, sex!  It's like you're part rabbit!  People ought to rub your feet for luck!

speaker: Martin
text: Come on now, you don't want to say something you're going to regret!  Now you're acting like a couple of fishwives! [_they both stare at him, offended_] See, I'm regretting that one already.

speaker: Daphne
text: Maybe I'd be less touchy if I didn't spend half my time cleaning up after you, and the other half on the phone to the garbage disposal repair man because one of your bloody big biscuits broke the blade!

speaker: Sherry
text: There's a lot of "B" words for a little girl.  Here's one you forgot...

speaker: Sherry/Daphne
text: B-!/Oh, don't you dare!

speaker: Sherry
text: What do you mean don't I dare! _They carry on arguing as Frasier enters.  They all stop when he slams the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Is Seattle experiencing a Prozac shortage?!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Daphne and Sherry have a little problem.  Actually, maybe you can settle it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry Dad, it was all I could do to get through my show. King Solomon has split his last baby for the day, my health is hanging by a thread. [_they start to protest_] Bup-bup-bup! You're just going to have to settle this amongst yourselves, quietly!

speaker: Daphne
text: You've got a lot of nerve talking to me that way!

speaker: Sherry
text: Me?  You're the one who started it, didn't she, Marty?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you're not putting me in the middle of this.

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't start anything.  You've had your big conk in my business all day!

speaker: Sherry
text: That better mean "nose"!

speaker: Daphne
text: And what if it doesn't?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!  Come on, knock it off.  Now, I said I wouldn't get involved in this, but... Daphne, you know, Sherry was only trying to be nice.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_picks up her bag_] Of course you'd take her side, she's the one who keeps your hammer toes warm at night.

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell's that supposed to mean?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, figure it out!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, Daph...  _Daphne leaves, slamming the door behind her.  FADE TO:_  **SUDDENLY THIS SUMMER**  _Scene Four - Niles's Apartment Niles is sitting on his couch, sipping wine and reading a book, with his cockatoo sitting on his shoulder.  He is dressed all in white, and there is a large fan blowing in one corner, but the heat still makes it hard for him to concentrate on his book or his wine._  [_N.B. All-white ensembles are a trademark of Tennessee Williams's plays - as are atmospheres of high sexual tension._] _The doorbell rings, which of course makes Baby shriek and dig her claws in._

speaker: Niles
text: Ow, ow!  Baby, go to your perch, go to your perch. _She does.  Niles gets up and flexes his shoulder before answering the door to a rather hot-and-bothered Daphne._

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm so sorry to bother you, Dr. Crane, but I had an awful row with Sherry and I can't go back there.  I tried a couple of my girlfriends, but they weren't home.  So... may I spend the night here?  _Niles stares at her in disbelief.  CUT TO: a few moments later. He is lying on the couch after fainting.  Daphne is reviving him._

speaker: Daphne
text: Relax, Dr. Crane, I'm just unbuttoning your shirt.  _He faints again.  End of Act One. (Time: 11:27)  Act Two.  Scene Five - Niles's Apartment Later, Niles awakes in the same position._

speaker: Daphne
text: Are you feeling any better?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  I don't know what happened, my knees never buckled like that before.  The wine and the heat must have made me dizzy.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, it is rather steamy in here.

speaker: Niles
text: I apologise for the lack of air conditioning.  It seems in order to live in an exclusive landmark building, one must have to sweat through the odd heat wave like a tortured character in a [_trails off as Daphne lifts her shirt up over the fan_] Tennessee... Williams... play.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't imagine what you must be thinking.  Me barging in, asking to stay the night... [_bends over and lets the air blow down the front of her shirt_]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, gee I'm just thinking so many things. [_takes a long sip of his wine_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Sherry just makes me so mad. [_turns around and lets it blow up her back_] She's been giving my number to strange men so they'd call and ask me out.

speaker: Niles
text: How dare she!  Why would she do such a thing?

speaker: Daphne
text: Because she says I'm too rigid.

speaker: Niles
text: Nonsense!

speaker: Daphne
text: And that I'm too picky.

speaker: Niles
text: Poppycock!

speaker: Daphne
text: And that I'd be much happier if I just went out and had sex with someone. _Niles stays quiet and sits next to Daphne thinking about a possible, but unlikely, future._

speaker: Niles
text: Just to play Devil's advocate...

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't tell me you agree with her!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  It's much too hot for hell to have frozen over.

speaker: Daphne
text: I mean, it's like caveman thinking!  "All Daphne needs is a quick roll in the hay!"

speaker: Niles
text: [_turned on:_] Yes, well...

speaker: Daphne
text: "A little slap and tickle would solve all her problems!"

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, um...

speaker: Daphne
text: The worse part is... I think she might be right.  Maybe part of why I got so mad at her is because she hit a nerve.

speaker: Niles
text: It's very possible.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_lying back:_] I mean, I have been keeping myself on the shelf lately.  I'm feeling a little like the good China.

speaker: Niles
text: Someone should be eating off you everyday.

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm... music?

speaker: Daphne
text: Lovely.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, I hope this doesn't sound terribly forward, but I'm _Niles cannot believe what he has just heard.  At his waist level the CD player pops open (rather imitating something else).  He pushes it closed again._

speaker: Daphne
text: Would it be all right if I took a cool bath?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, of course.  It's upstairs, third door on your left.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you. [_runs up to the first balcony_]

speaker: Niles
text: There are fresh towels in the linen closet - use the Indian cotton, it will be more gentle on your skin.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, you're always thinking of me. [_she leaves_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_to himself:_] You have no idea! **THE NIGHT OF THE I WANNA** _Scene Six - Niles's Apartment. Later, Niles is setting up the living room: Passion fruit has been laid out in a tray.  He takes a bottle of champagne from an ice bucket and is starting to open it when Daphne enters, wearing one of his dressing gowns._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane?  Ooh, that fan feels good. _As Daphne comes down the stairs, the fan blows open the dressing gown below the belt, revealing her legs and a glimpse of her underwear. She laughs and covers up.  In Niles's hand, the champagne pops open and overflows (again imitating something else)._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, sorry!

speaker: Daphne
text: That's quite all right.  Thanks for lending me your dressing gown.  Don't you just love the feel of silk on your skin?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, there's nothing quite like it.  Passion fruit?

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you! [_sits on the couch and takes a bite_] You know, if you keep treating me like this I'll never want to leave.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs, then:_] Champagne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, you shouldn't have! [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: I love champagne, but it's a drink for two and I never have anyone to share it with. [_pours two_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, there are things you miss when you're on your own: champagne, another person's touch - even if it's just holding hands.  I guess you've been missing that sort of thing too since you and Mrs. Crane split up. [_touches Niles's hand_]

speaker: Niles
text: Well actually, Maris never held hands.  She had a slight webbing which made her self-conscious.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm sure there are other intimacies you miss.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, actually I still have a longing for... [_she chuckles_] I still have a desire for, um, to have... Daphne/Niles: Sex?/[_offering:_] Fruit?

speaker: Niles
text: I mean, yeah, sex.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'd love some.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughs:_] I mean fruit!  Although sex is good too!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry, Dr. Crane, I guess I just have sex on the mind tonight!  _Niles watches as she dips her passion fruit into her champagne and sucks it sensually._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that happens.

speaker: Daphne
text: And this weather doesn't help, does it? [_lays back:_] The heat gets inside you... it makes you so aware of your body.  It's like nature's way of letting you know you're still an animal. _Niles lets out a low growl.  Daphne exhales and droops back over the couch._

speaker: Niles
text: God, it's hot in here.

speaker: Daphne
text: It seems to be getting hotter every minute.

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking some ice from the wine cooler_] Ice?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh yes, I could use some right now. _She takes one of the two pieces in his hand, but instead of dropping it in her glass she rubs it over her neck (and steals a glance at his butt)._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_Moaning:_] Ohhh... Oh yes, that's better... _Staring at her in his daze, Niles doesn't know whether he's in heaven or not._

speaker: Daphne
text: Where's your piece?

speaker: Niles
text: [_snaps out of it, opens his hand:_] It melted.  I'll get another.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, unless it cools down, I'm afraid we won't be getting much sleep tonight.

speaker: Niles
text: Shame we have just the one fan.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, really? [_plain:_] Yes, that is a shame.  The two of us and just one fan... _The sexual tension between the two is now at its height.  It is obvious that not only is Niles thinking about jumping into bed with Daphne, but Daphne wants the same.  They both stare into the fan, waiting for events to happen.  Who will be the first to crack?_

speaker: Daphne
text: Well of course, you're the host, you take it.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I couldn't sleep at all knowing you were in the next room all hot and... hot.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well... I suppose, under the circumstances... we could both sleep in the same room.

speaker: Niles
text: [_his heart pounding:_] It does... oscillate.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_mouth wide open:_] What?

speaker: Niles
text: The fan.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh...  _They both are ready for sex, until a little bell on Daphne's watch goes off._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, dear.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's time to take my pills.  I forgot all about them, they're back at the apartment.

speaker: Niles
text: What pills?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's my thyroid.  Nothing serious, it's just a bit overactive. If I don't take my pills I tend to faint dead away.

speaker: Niles
text: What's the point in a fainting couch if you can't use it once in a while?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll just run over and get them.  I'll come right back.

speaker: Niles
text: No!  We'll go together and I'll run up for you.  If you and Sherry get into the same room together the two of you might make up... [_covering:_] ...more reasons to fight with one another. _Daphne agrees and goes to get changed. Niles is now the one who is hot under the collar so he cools himself off on the fan.  FADE TO:_  **THE BATH MENAGERIE**  _Scene Seven - Frasier's Apartment Niles enters Frasier's apartment silently.  Sherry is trying to settle things with Martin in the kitchen.  It seems that Sherry has forgiven Daphne, and that she will make it up with her.  Niles silently creeps around to find Daphne's pills.  However, Sherry spots him._

speaker: Sherry
text: Nilesy!  Where did you come from?

speaker: Martin
text: What are you doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne's taken refuge at my apartment for the night.  I just stopped by to get a few of her things. [_moves away_]

speaker: Martin
text: Back!  You weren't going to tell us, you were going to let us worry all night?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I was going to tell you on my way out.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh this is stupid, I'm going to call her and get her back here and we're going to work this whole thing out.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, it's a waste of time, she's so upset there is no way she'll ever set foot in this apartment tonight!

speaker: Niles
text: If you don't believe me, you can ask her yourselves.

speaker: Daphne
text: I just remembered, my pills aren't in the medicine cabinet, they're on my dresser.

speaker: Niles
text: What courage, pulling yourself together like this, just scurry on down to the car, and I'll only be a moment. [_Martin holds him back_]

speaker: Martin
text: Er Daphne, Sherry and I talked about this, and we really feel bad about this.  You know, the whole thing is just a misunderstanding.

speaker: Sherry
text: If you want, I suppose we could sit down and talk it out.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I suppose we could.

speaker: Niles
text: Obviously these two wildcats can't come to terms.  The best thing will be for them to be apart.  I know, I'm a psychiatrist.

speaker: Sherry
text: No, your dad is right.  Now Daphne just misunderstood.

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't exactly misunderstand.  You did set me up with a total stranger!

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, but he's not a stranger, he comes in the bar all the time.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, a barfly!  Much better.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, there you go again!

speaker: Daphne
text: Me!

speaker: Martin
text: [_trying to mend_] You know, you two are really a lot alike.

speaker: Both
text: How dare you!/I'm nothing like her.

speaker: Niles
text: [_happy about the arguments, he runs to the medicine cabinet:_] Talk amongst yourselves!  _Martin leaves and even Eddie buries his head in a pillow, tired of the arguing.  Meanwhile, in his bathroom, Frasier is soaking up his troubles in a bath of bubbles.  His eyes are closed, under a therapeutic mask._

speaker: Martin
text: [_o.s._] Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_wakes up_] I'm taking a bath.

speaker: Martin
text: Bubbles?!

speaker: Frasier
text: They're aromatherapeutic.  And exactly what part of "I'm taking a bath" did you take to mean "come on in"?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm sorry to tax your delicate system, but Daphne is back, and she and Sherry are at it again, and I don't know what to do and this is your department!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right, unless blood has been spilled, and on a carpeted area, I don't care.  Now get out!

speaker: Sherry
text: [_walks in:_] There you are!  Marty, I tried, but that girl has no manners whatsoever. [_sits on bath_] Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you mind!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_entering:_] I knew I'd find you in here! [_to Frasier:_] Whatever they're telling you about me, it's not true.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, please, you can't come in here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Why not?  She can!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, she can't, no-one can!

speaker: Niles
text: [_entering with Daphne's things:_] Frasier, have you no decency? Daphne, let's go!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right!  I am moments away from succumbing once and for all to this flu.  I am going to take one stab at this and then I am going to sink, Hippopotamus-like, beneath the bubbles. I think what this all comes down to is a dispute over turf. Daphne and Sherry are like two animals scent-marking their territory, which in this case is you, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: You couldn't come out with a less disgusting comparison?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right, fine, it's like the Roman emperor Tiberius, his mother Livia, and his wife Vipsania.

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Sherry
text: Huh?

speaker: Daphne
text: Who?

speaker: Niles
text: Go on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine!  Daphne: your primary role in this household is to take care of Dad.  Sherry: you also enjoy taking care of Dad.  I suspect that your attempts to find Daphne a boyfriend are really an unconscious ploy to get her out of the way. [_she starts to protest_] It's unconscious.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, naturally you are threatened by this and you feel you are no longer needed.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I have been feeling a bit unwanted lately.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, a night without your services will have them singing a different tune, let's go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nobody's going to be singing anything tonight!  Daphne, I think we now all understand why you stormed out of here earlier. A strong emotion like not feeling wanted can drive anyone into a rash and impulsive act.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_glances at Niles_] Yes, it nearly did... I mean, yes it did.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, at the root of this, you're both just feeling insecure.

speaker: Martin
text: Exactly!

speaker: Frasier
text: Though it could probably have been avoided if Dad had been sensitive enough to remind you that you are both important in his life.

speaker: Martin
text: What are you saying?  That it's my fault?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well I must admit, a few reassuring words might just have done the trick.

speaker: Sherry
text: Marty does have difficulty expressing his feelings.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I don't!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Sherry...

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, save it honey, it wasn't our fault.

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, it was! [_to Sherry:_] You said that she was skinny and [_to Daphne:_] you said that she was big-mouthed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, that is not important.  We all feel better now.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh look, I am running out of patience, I am running out of strength, and I am running out of bubbles!  Please, the lecture has ended!

speaker: Daphne
text: You're a good psychiatrist, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Sherry
text: You sure are, hon'. [_as they leave:_] You see, Marty, it isn't just a lot of hooey! _Frasier, too tired to be insulted, sinks into his bath.  Niles is the only one left._

speaker: Niles
text: [_sarcastic:_] Thank you very much!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh please, Niles.  Look, unconsciously you knew it wasn't right.  That's why you brought Daphne back here.

speaker: Niles
text: No, we came back to fetch her damn thyroid pills.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're a doctor.  Why didn't you just use your prescription pad?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God...

speaker: Frasier
text: Isn't there an all-night pharmacy across the street from your building?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God!  _Niles leaves nearly in tears, whilst Frasier ignores him and sinks under the bubbles.  However, the bubbles just cause him to come up and sneeze._
